item.title: Structure and interpretation of computer programs
item.description: The wizard book is considered a timeless classic that I will always hold dear to my heart for introducing me to computer science. It touches a lot of topics, making it a great introduction. Still, starting with functional programming is arguably less intuitive for most people. Most people don't care about purity (yet). Why would they?
